titles.title: Hadronic contributions to the muon anomalous magnetic moment Workshop. $(g-2)_{\mu}$: Quo vadis? Workshop. Mini proceedings

figures.caption: The Pauli form factor in the limit of the vanishing external momentum $k\to0$ $F_2(0)$ as function of the pseudoscalar meson mass $M$. The red dotted (blue dashed) line denotes the dispersive evaluation due to the three-particle (two-particle) discontinuity. The black dashed-dotted line denotes the sum of both contributions. The pink solid line is obtained by the direct evaluation of the corresponding two-loop integral.

SUSY contributions to $a_\mu$ for the SPS and other benchmark points (red), and for the ``degenerate solutions'' from Ref.\ \cite{Adam:2010uz}. The yellow and blue bands are the $\pm 1~\sigma$ errors from the Brookhaven and the planned Fermilab measurements.
Preliminary result of energy scan by KEDR
Left: Relative accuracy in $\pi^+\pi^-$ cross section measurement. Right: Preliminary $\pi^+\pi^-$ form factor measurement by CMD-3. Color shows different separation methods.

Left: Measurement of the $\ee\to\omega\pi^0\to\pi^0\pi^0\gamma$ process cross section with SND ~\cite{snd}. Right: Measurement of the $\ee\to 3(\pi^+\pi^-)$ process cross section with CMD-3~\cite{cmd} in comparison with BaBar (open points)

abstracts.value: We present the mini-proceedings of the workshops Hadronic contributions to the muon anomalous magnetic moment: strategies for improvements of the accuracy of the theoretical prediction and $(g-2)_{\mu}$: Quo vadis?, both held in Mainz from April 1$^{\rm rst}$ to 5$^{\rm th}$ and from April 7$^{\rm th}$ to 10$^{\rm th}$, 2014, respectively.
